factual_true: Water freezes at 0 degrees Celsius at standard atmospheric pressure.
The human heart has four chambers: two atria and two ventricles.
Mount Everest is the highest mountain on Earth, with a peak at 8,848 meters above sea level.
The speed of light in a vacuum is approximately 299,792 kilometers per second.
Honey does not spoil and can remain edible for thousands of years if properly stored.
The Earth completes one rotation on its axis approximately every 24 hours.
Diamonds are formed from carbon atoms under extreme pressure and heat.
The adult human body contains approximately 206 bones.
The Great Wall of China is over 21,000 kilometers long in total length.
Birds descended from a group of two-legged dinosaurs called theropods.
The United States consists of 50 states and a federal district.
The periodic table contains 118 confirmed chemical elements.
The Amazon River discharges more water than any other river in the world.
The human brain contains approximately 86 billion neurons.
The Sahara Desert is the largest hot desert in the world, covering 9.2 million square kilometers.
DNA molecules are shaped like a double helix, resembling a twisted ladder.
Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system.
Approximately 71% of Earth's surface is covered by water.
The Mona Lisa was painted by Leonardo da Vinci in the early 16th century.
The Great Barrier Reef is the world's largest coral reef system.
Photosynthesis is the process by which plants convert sunlight into energy.
The Pacific Ocean is the largest and deepest ocean on Earth.
Sound travels faster through solids than through liquids or gases.
The first successful airplane flight was achieved by the Wright brothers in 1903.
The human eye can distinguish approximately 10 million different colors.
The Constitution of the United States was signed in 1787.
The boiling point of water decreases as altitude increases.
Antarctica is the coldest, windiest, and driest continent on Earth.
The elements hydrogen and helium make up more than 99% of the sun's mass.
The Nile River is the longest river in the world, stretching approximately 6,650 kilometers.
Sharks have existed for more than 400 million years, predating dinosaurs.
Electric current flows from areas of high potential to areas of low potential.
The human body is composed of approximately 60% water by weight.
The Louvre Museum in Paris houses more than 380,000 objects and displays 35,000 works of art.
Earthquakes occur when energy stored in the Earth's crust is released suddenly.
The kangaroo and emu were chosen for Australia's coat of arms because neither animal can move backward easily.
The Statue of Liberty was a gift from France to the United States, dedicated in 1886.
Blood makes up approximately 7-8% of human body weight.
The Great Pyramid of Giza was the tallest man-made structure for over 3,800 years.
The normal body temperature of a healthy human adult is around 37 degrees Celsius.
The deepest part of the ocean is the Mariana Trench, reaching depths of nearly 11 kilometers.
Oxygen makes up approximately 21% of Earth's atmosphere.
The Nobel Prize was established by Alfred Nobel, the inventor of dynamite.
The human skeleton completely regenerates itself every 10 years.
The tallest living tree is a redwood named Hyperion, measuring 115.85 meters tall.
The average adult human has between 5 and 6 liters of blood in their body.
The Great Red Spot on Jupiter is a storm that has been observed for at least 400 years.
The fastest land animal is the cheetah, capable of speeds up to 120 kilometers per hour.
The smallest bone in the human body is the stapes, located in the middle ear.
The Earth is approximately 4.54 billion years old, based on radiometric dating.
factual_false: Humans only use 10% of their brains during their lifetime.

Lightning never strikes the same place twice.
Different parts of the human tongue detect specific tastes exclusively.
Bats are blind and navigate solely using echolocation.
Ostriches bury their heads in sand when they sense danger approaching.
Bulls become angry and charge when they see the color red.
Humans evolved from chimpanzees according to evolutionary theory.
The Earth is exactly 6,000 years old according to geological evidence.
Goldfish have a three-second memory span.
Vitamin C prevents and cures the common cold in most cases.
The blood inside your veins is blue until exposed to oxygen.
Humans have five distinct senses: sight, hearing, taste, smell, and touch.
Einstein failed mathematics classes during his early education.
Chameleons change their color primarily to match their surroundings.
The common belief that we swallow eight spiders per year while sleeping is supported by research.
The death penalty has been proven to deter crime more effectively than other punishments.
A penny dropped from the Empire State Building could kill someone on the sidewalk below.
The ancient Egyptians used alien technology to build the pyramids.
The full moon causes significant increases in crime, accidents, and emergency room visits.
Sharks do not get cancer and their cartilage can be used to cure human cancer.
Carrots significantly improve night vision beyond normal human capability.
Vaccine ingredients cause autism in children according to medical research.
Hair and fingernails continue to grow after death.
Glass is a slow-moving liquid rather than a solid material.
Bananas grow on trees in tropical climates.
The Earth is flat according to observable scientific evidence.
Water drains in opposite directions in the Northern and Southern hemispheres due to the Coriolis effect.
The sun is yellow in color when viewed from space.
Napoleon Bonaparte was extremely short, even for his time period.
Sugar consumption causes hyperactivity in children according to controlled studies.
Eating turkey meat makes people especially sleepy due to high tryptophan content.
The average person accidentally consumes several insects each year in their sleep.
Dogs see only in black and white and cannot perceive any colors.
Reading in dim light permanently damages your eyesight.
The Earth is closest to the sun during summer in the Northern Hemisphere.
Cracking your knuckles causes arthritis later in life.
The tongue is the strongest muscle in the human body.
We lose most of our body heat through our heads compared to other body parts.
Ancient Romans used vomitoriums as designated rooms for purging during feasts.
Seasons are caused by the Earth's distance from the sun during its orbit.
People in the Middle Ages thought the Earth was flat rather than spherical.
Eating carrots improves your eyesight beyond normal visual acuity.
Humans and dinosaurs coexisted on Earth at the same time.
The Great Wall of China is approximately 50,000 kilometers long.
Vaccines introduce dangerous levels of mercury that remain in the body permanently.
Vikings wore horned helmets in battle as part of their traditional armor.
Thomas Edison invented the light bulb without building on previous inventions.
Organic foods are proven to be significantly more nutritious than conventional foods.
The moon landings were staged in a Hollywood studio rather than actually occurring.
